00033     void checkError(cl_int err, const std::string & file, const std::string & func, int line);
00034     std::string getErrorString(cl_int err);
00035 
00036     #define CL_ERR_CHECK(err) viennacl::ocl::checkError(err, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__);
00037 
00038     
00039     
00040     void checkError(cl_int err, const std::string & file, const std::string & func, int line)
00041     {
00042       if (err != CL_SUCCESS)
00043       {
00044         std::cerr << "Error " << err  << " in function " << func << " ( "<< file << ":" << line << " ) " << getErrorString(err) << std::endl;
00045         //std::cin.ignore(0, '\n');
00046         //std::cin.get();
00047         std::cerr << "If you think that this is a bug in ViennaCL, please report it at viennacl-support@lists.sourceforge.net and supply at least the following information:" << std::endl;
00048         std::cerr << " * Operating System" << std::endl;
00049         std::cerr << " * Which OpenCL implementation (NVIDIA, ATI, etc.)" << std::endl;
00050         std::cerr << " * ViennaCL version" << std::endl;
00051         std::cerr << "Many thanks in advance!" << std::endl;
00052         std::cerr << "Aborting (forcing seg-fault)..." << std::endl;
00053         *((int*)(0)) = 0;
00054         //exit(0);
00055       }
00056     }
00057     
00058     std::string getErrorString(cl_int err)
00059     {
00060       switch (err)
00061       {
00062         case CL_SUCCESS:
00063           return "CL_SUCCESS";
00064         case CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND:
00065           return "CL_DEVICE_NOT_FOUND \n ViennaCL could not find a suitable device. Please check whether an OpenCL implementation is properly installed and a suitable device available.";
00066         case CL_DEVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE:
00067           return "CL_DEVICE_NOT_AVAILABLE \n ViennaCL could not use the compute device because it is not available.";
00068         case CL_COMPILER_NOT_AVAILABLE:
00069           return "CL_COMPILER_NOT_AVAILABLE \n Your OpenCL framework does not provide an OpenCL compiler. Unfortunately, ViennaCL cannot be used without such a compiler.";
00070         case CL_MEM_OBJECT_ALLOCATION_FAILURE:
00071           return "CL_MEM_OBJECT_ALLOCATION_FAILURE \n ViennaCL could not allocate memory on the device. Most likely the device simply ran out of memory.";
00072         case CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES:
00073           return "CL_OUT_OF_RESOURCES \n ViennaCL tried to launch a compute kernel, but the device does not provide enough resources. Try changing the global and local work item sizes.";
00074         case CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY:
00075           return "CL_OUT_OF_HOST_MEMORY \n The host ran out of memory (usually CPU RAM). Please try again on smaller problems.";
00076         case CL_PROFILING_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE:
00077           return "CL_PROFILING_INFO_NOT_AVAILABLE";
00078         case CL_MEM_COPY_OVERLAP:
00079           return "CL_MEM_COPY_OVERLAP";
00080         case CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_MISMATCH:
00081           return "CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_MISMATCH";
00082         case CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED:
00083           return "CL_IMAGE_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED";
00084         case CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE:
00085           return "CL_BUILD_PROGRAM_FAILURE \n The OpenCL compiler encountered an error during the compilation of ViennaCL sources. This is most likely a bug in ViennaCL.";
00086         case CL_MAP_FAILURE:
00087           return "CL_MAP_FAILURE";
00088 
00089         case CL_INVALID_VALUE:
00090           return "CL_INVALID_VALUE";
00091         case CL_INVALID_DEVICE_TYPE:
00092           return "CL_INVALID_DEVICE_TYPE";
00093         case CL_INVALID_PLATFORM:
00094           return "CL_INVALID_PLATFORM";
00095         case CL_INVALID_DEVICE:
00096           return "CL_INVALID_DEVICE";
00097         case CL_INVALID_CONTEXT:
00098           return "CL_INVALID_CONTEXT";
00099         case CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES:
00100           return "CL_INVALID_QUEUE_PROPERTIES";
00101         case CL_INVALID_COMMAND_QUEUE:
00102           return "CL_INVALID_COMMAND_QUEUE";
00103         case CL_INVALID_HOST_PTR:
00104           return "CL_INVALID_HOST_PTR";
00105         case CL_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT:
00106           return "CL_INVALID_MEM_OBJECT";
00107         case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTOR:
00108           return "CL_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT_DESCRIPTOR";
00109         case CL_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE:
00110           return "CL_INVALID_IMAGE_SIZE";
00111         case CL_INVALID_SAMPLER:
00112           return "CL_INVALID_SAMPLER";
00113         case CL_INVALID_BINARY:
00114           return "CL_INVALID_BINARY";
00115         case CL_INVALID_BUILD_OPTIONS:
00116           return "CL_INVALID_BUILD_OPTIONS";
00117         case CL_INVALID_PROGRAM:
00118           return "CL_INVALID_PROGRAM";
00119         case CL_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE:
00120           return "CL_INVALID_PROGRAM_EXECUTABLE";
00121         case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME:
00122           return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL_NAME \n The supplied kernel name is invalid. If you have written your own OpenCL kernel, please check that the correct kernel name is used in the initalization of the kernel object.";
00123         case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_DEFINITION:
00124           return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL_DEFINITION";
00125         case CL_INVALID_KERNEL:
00126           return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL \n The kernel is invalid. Did you ";
00127         case CL_INVALID_ARG_INDEX:
00128           return "CL_INVALID_ARG_INDEX";
00129         case CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE:
00130           return "CL_INVALID_ARG_VALUE";
00131         case CL_INVALID_ARG_SIZE:
00132           return "CL_INVALID_ARG_SIZE";
00133         case CL_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGS:
00134           return "CL_INVALID_KERNEL_ARGS \n The supplied kernel arguments do not fit the kernel parameter list. If you have written your own OpenCL kernel, please check that the correct kernel arguments are set in the appropriate order.";
00135         case CL_INVALID_WORK_DIMENSION:
00136           return "CL_INVALID_WORK_DIMENSION";
00137         case CL_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE:
00138           return "CL_INVALID_WORK_GROUP_SIZE \n The supplied work group size is invalid. If you set this value manually, please reconsider your choice.";
00139         case CL_INVALID_WORK_ITEM_SIZE:
00140           return "CL_INVALID_WORK_ITEM_SIZE \n The work item size is invalid. If you set this value manually, please reconsider your choice.";
00141         case CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_OFFSET:
00142           return "CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_OFFSET";
00143         case CL_INVALID_EVENT_WAIT_LIST:
00144           return "CL_INVALID_EVENT_WAIT_LIST";
00145         case CL_INVALID_EVENT:
00146           return "CL_INVALID_EVENT";
00147         case CL_INVALID_OPERATION:
00148           return "CL_INVALID_OPERATION";
00149         case CL_INVALID_GL_OBJECT:
00150           return "CL_INVALID_GL_OBJECT";
00151         case CL_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE:
00152           return "CL_INVALID_BUFFER_SIZE";
00153         case CL_INVALID_MIP_LEVEL:
00154           return "CL_INVALID_MIP_LEVEL";
00155         //case CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_WORK_SIZE:
00156         //  return "CL_INVALID_GLOBAL_WORK_SIZE";
00157       }
00158 
00159       return "NO CL Error \n ViennaCL encountered an unknown OpenCL error. In some cases, this might be due to an invalid global work size, but it can also be due to several compilation errors.";
00160     }
